cold_snaps.status: No active cold snap is observed currently.  The count for this year stands at 6, while the average is around 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference so far is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwave.status: No active heatwave is observed currently.  The count for this year stands at 6, while the average is around 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Ranked 8th for total rainfall, today's storm had precipitation totalling 13.04mm, falling at 8.6mm per hour at times during the 7.9 hour long storm.  27.64mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 15.9 hour precipitation event.  At times precipitation was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour was the peak rain rate recorded on 03 September 2025 ranking first from our records.  The storm lasted 2.0 hours and 7.99mm of rain fell.

storm.status: On 23 November 2024, rainfall persisted for 23.2 hours, accumulating 24.56mm at falling at 6.4mm per hour at times.
There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: Currently experiencing a significant rainy period, ranked 5th longest since August 2024.  So far, it has lasted 9 consecutive days beginning 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (205°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles was the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 77.31 miles.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1568 m) and inside temperature (up 2.1°C) when compared to today.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 713m and a peak of 1594m, averaging 1089.8m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; the temperature will feel pleasantly warm. Also, oppressively muggy and sticky and little or no wind. Some rain can be expected, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Weather could become unsettled.
